instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2914 Quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Hi.

Board came in, quarter fan spin.
I happened to hold it with my thumb on the BIOS chip for a little while and then it worked. Cooled off, no work. Thumb on, worked.

Re-flowed the chip and now it powers every time. I will of course change the chip but someone please tell me why or point me to a link for an explanation please?

threads.title: 820-2914 Quarter fan spin
threads.message: MX chip? They do fail sometimes. You can heat them up and read them and flash it over into another one.

threads.title: 820-2914 Quarter fan spin
threads.message:
25Q064A. Micron

I'll have to do some reading on the physical construction to have a hope of figuring out how the heat helps but for now I think I'll read the chip and get paid.

Thanks Duke

threads.title: 820-2914 Quarter fan spin
threads.message: Not sure this will last. Expect a return on this one.....

threads.title: 820-2914 Quarter fan spin
threads.message: Flashed a new chip and replaced. Should be OK with new EEPROM right?

threads.title: 820-2914 Quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Thought as much.

There is no way I would send a machine out as working simply by heat blasting SPI ROM chip. That's what the forum is all about right?... To repair things properly!

Many thanks.
